A fantastic game on its own without mods, and the mods push it closer to absolute glory. 10/10, a must if you own VR. This has been my only means of working out during the COVID-19 quarantine, and it works. I always end up sweating buckets and smelling like an ape. My arms are constantly sore, but like most people who play beatsaber, that doesn't stop them. Buy the game for yourself or a friend who has VR and you'll see for yourself, it's addicting.

This is one of my top 10 favorite games. It is about 5X better than the first game, which is a high bar to cross. Here's why:
*Audio/ Visuals-- This game has a great soundtrack, like the last one. But more impressive are the visuals, even with today's graphics this game looks incredible. All the nature and mechanical workings make this even more atmospheric than the original.
*Writing-- Yes, Portal had great writing, but Glados' voice was always pretty creepy. I was scared of her rather than laughing with her. In this game, that has changed, probably due to more voice actors. Wheatley and Cave Johnson are great voices, and made me laugh much more than Glados did in the original. Also, somehow Glados is less scary and more funny in this game. The fantastic writing and voice acting make this game really funny and clever 
*Content-- Longer Single player campaign with creative puzzles and plotpoints? Check. Multiplayer campaign with equally good puzzles? Check. A test chamber maker where you can make any type of puzzle you want? Check. The ability to share those levels online so you can play other peoples' levels alone or with friends? Check. And developer commentary, trailers, and more extras? CHECK.

This game is amazing, buy it for your own sake.
Surprisingly replayable! This game has just enough minimum narrative to keep your actions purposeful and varied, but also a great maximum depth of lore for those interested.
It's super fun to play alone or with my sister. I've spent a lot of time on it during Quarantine! I definitely recommend this game to others.

Özet şeklinde baştan yazayım: Bu efsane oyunu hala oynamamışsanız gerçekten çok şey kaybetmişsinizdir demektir.

Oyun her zaman kaliteli işlere imza atan ve ilk çıktığında ilkleri  yaşatan Valve kalitesinde bir yapım. Tek oyunculu modda oynadığınızda hikayenin sizi sürüklediği yerlere gerçekten hayran kalıyorsunuz. Basiçe şunu şuraya koy bulmacayı çöz gibi bir klasik araştırma oyunu değil yani. Bir film tadında oynuyorsunuz oyunu. Testler ne çok zor ne de çok basit. Bazen "çok basit olan şeyi göremiyorum" dediğiniz oluyor (ben çok dedim) ve bulunca bu muydu arkadaş dediğiniz durumlar az değil.

Kampanya zamanlarında %90 indirimle 1,85 TL'ye düşüyor zaten, bir gofret parası. Hiç düşünmeden kütüphanenize ekleyin ve hikayeyi zevkle devam ettirin. Oyun sonu zaten hikayenin kalitesini ortaya koyuyor.

Oynayın, oynattırın.

gucci game

Honestly, I spent nearly 29 hours on the game alone, without the Co-op, and even if, this game works a charm online.
Much of Valve's trademark personality went into this game, and you can tell, plus the developers got really creative with it.
One of the many great things about this game that it benefits from everything Portal's one and a half hour singleplayer mode, and expanded MUCH more on that, with nearly 15 hours in my playthrough.
It introduces so much, that even MANY years later, it still holds up Gameplay-wise and Graphical-wise.
Seriously, like the graphics this game pulls off with the physics engine is AMAZING.
Especially with parts like the opening scene, that was a combination of good Physics, modeling, texturing, animation, and you name it.
Even the personality cores, like Wheatley. They have a lot of charm and realism to their design, that you can't help but smile whenever Wheatley moves or something, it's funny as all hell.
Oh and don't get me started about the comedy, a lot of this game radiates Sass. It's honestly impressive.

In conclusion, why wouldn't you buy this game?
It's portal 2, it's absolutely worth every penny you get it for.
It's amazing in every single aspect, plus at least 5 hours of my playthrough were spent on the test chamber creation tool on its own.

Critically acclaimed game, one of its kind. As a puzzle game, it didn't need a plot to be successful, but Valve has exceeded all expectations and have gone done it anyways. A classic that still lives up to today's standard.
